channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Trump's presidency might put Taiwan's security at risk', say Taiwanese Americans
China: Two women lock crying toddler in plane's washroom to educate child
item.description: Two women locked a crying toddler in the washroom during a flight in China with the grandmother’s consent, aiming to calm the child and avoid disturbing other passengers. Despite intentions to help, the act sparked significant online backlash and debates on how to handle crying children in public. The incident was confirmed by Juneyao Airlines.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Heathrow airport border staff announce new strike
item.description: Hundreds of Border Force officers at London Heathrow are set to strike for four days starting Saturday over working conditions related to inflexible rosters. Around 650 members will also refuse overtime for 18 days from September 4. The union cites stress and long hours, while the government aims to minimize travel disruption and continue talks with the union.

item.title: New Swiss nuclear dawn seen decades away at best
item.description: The Swiss government has announced plans to lift the 2017 ban on building new nuclear power plants to address climate goals and geopolitical uncertainties. Experts and politicians foresee decades-long challenges in overcoming political, financial, and bureaucratic obstacles before any new plants can be operational.

item.title: Meghan Markle’s fashion choices steal the spotlight again: 'This chapter is about ...'
item.description: Meghan Markle is being recognized for her fashion during recent trips to Nigeria and Colombia. She explains her choices are strategic, aimed at promoting brands she believes in, particularly female-led ones. Her efforts include investing in products like the Cesta Collective basket bag, supporting Rwandan artisans, and enhancing her brand, American Riviera Orchard.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US reports nearly 300 cases of mosquito-borne West Nile virus: All you need to know
item.description: The US remains vigilant as West Nile virus cases arise, impacting individuals like Dr Anthony Fauci, who was hospitalised. Transmitted via mosquito bites, the virus mainly surfaces during summer and fall. No vaccines exist, making mosquito bite prevention crucial. Reports highlight rare but severe complications, stressing the importance of awareness and protective measures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Telegram founder Pavel Durov faces allegations of violence against his child: ‘He threatened to kill him,’ claims ex-partner
item.description: Telegram founder Pavel Durov faces legal challenges from allegations by his former partner Irina Bolgar, accusing him of harming their son between 2021 and 2022. After his arrest in Paris for Telegram's alleged misuse, Durov was placed under investigation and released on bail. The investigation continues in France, drawing international attention.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How Kamala Harris brushed off question on Donald Trump's racial barbs?
item.description: In a CNN interview, Kamala Harris and running mate Tim Walz discussed their campaign priorities, including support for the middle class and affordable housing. Harris did not engage with Trump's racial remarks, while Walz clarified comments about his military service. Harris also addressed US aid to Israel amid the Gaza conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rare cyclonic storm Asna to hit Gujarat, all you need to know
item.description: The India Meteorological Department has warned that a deep depression may turn into a cyclonic storm in the Arabian Sea off Gujarat's Kachchh and Pakistan. The depression is rapidly intensifying and is expected to develop into a cyclonic storm within the next 6 hours. Local authorities taking measures, advising residents to seek shelter in sturdier buildings.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Florida man executed for 1994 murder: 'College freshman beaten and slit, sister tied to tree and raped'
item.description: Loran Cole, 57, was executed in Florida for the 1994 murder and rape of two college students. His appeals, which cited severe childhood abuse and mental illness, were denied by the U.S. Supreme Court. The execution, ordered by Governor Ron DeSantis, is Florida’s first since the October execution of Michael Zack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hiker survives freezing night stranded alone on Mount Shavano: ‘Fell at least 20 times on steep slopes and ...’
item.description: A man separated from his office group while climbing Mount Shavano in Colorado endured falls and survived a night in freezing rain and high winds. After a large search and rescue effort, including multiple agencies, he was found and sent to the hospital. His belongings were moved, which had caused his descent confusion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US teens arrested after forcing 12-year-old to lick shoe in shocking video: 'Extra layer of disrespect'
item.description: Two teenagers from Golden Valley High School in California were arrested after a video showed them bullying 12-year-old Carter Lashaul, forcing him to lick a shoe. They are charged with battery, false imprisonment, and conspiracy. Advocates and Lashaul’s family point out the lasting emotional impact and demand an apology from the perpetrators.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Robert F Kennedy Jr an asset or a liability for Trump this US election? Here’s what poll says
item.description: Robert F Kennedy Jr, having suspended his presidential campaign and opting for an independent candidacy, has endorsed Donald Trump for the 2024 election. According to a recent Quinnipiac University poll, Kennedy's endorsement seems to have minimal impact, with 64% of voters indicating no change in their perspective on Trump, though 20% view him more favorably.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 32k kms in 12 days: Pope Francis to embark on most extensive journey since becoming Catholic Church head
item.description: At 87, Pope Francis is preparing for a significant 12-day trip to Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, East Timor, and Singapore, covering 32,000 kilometers and featuring 16 speeches. This journey, delayed from 2020, aims to silence critics questioning his capacity following health issues. Another trip begins just weeks later.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No active shooter': Sheriff clarifies after panic erupts at Magic Kingdom, watch video
item.description: Chaos broke out at Walt Disney World due to false rumors of an active shooter. The Orange County Sheriff's office clarified that there was no shooter, explaining the chaos as a result of a fight and a 'popping' sound, potentially from a balloon. The incident caused confusion and fear among park visitors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I thought they will kill me,' Bangladesh rights activist calls for justice after 5 years in captivity
item.description: Michael Chakma, a Bangladeshi indigenous rights activist, was freed after five years of abduction and torture. His ordeal highlights abuses under Sheikh Hasina's regime. Chakma's release aligns with Bangladesh's new interim government announcing an investigation into enforced disappearances since 2010. Many families hope for answers about their missing loved ones.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump rips Kamala Harris after CNN interview: 'She didn’t look like a leader... Can't see her with Kim Jong-un'
item.description: Former President Donald Trump criticized Vice President Kamala Harris after her major TV interview, accusing her of incoherent rambling and questioning her leadership abilities. Trump's focus was on Harris's evolving positions on issues like Medicare for All and the Green New Deal. Harris defended her perspectives, emphasizing her core values remain unchanged.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Storm watch: Could 'Francine' be the next named storm in the Atlantic?
item.description: The National Hurricane Center is monitoring two potential tropical systems in the Atlantic. One low-pressure area, halfway between Cabo Verde and the Lesser Antilles, could develop by early next week. Another has emerged off West Africa. Both disturbances could bring rain and gusty winds to the Lesser Antilles, possibly becoming the sixth named storm, Francine.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK PM Keir Starmer under fire for removing £100k Margaret Thatcher portrait from Downing Street, critics call it ‘petty’
item.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's removal of a portrait of Margaret Thatcher from Downing Street has created political friction. The £100,000 painting, commissioned in 2009, honored Thatcher's legacy. Some of her supporters, including Sir John Redwood, view the act as an attempt to appease the left wing of Starmer’s party, sparking significant backlash.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ties with India: FBI offers $ 25,000 reward for information leading to arrest of Cindy Rodriguez-Singh on her son's murder
item.description: The FBI is offering a $25,000 reward for information leading to the arrest of Cindy Rodriguez-Singh, accused of murdering her son Noel Alvarez. She was last seen in March 2023 heading to India with her family. Authorities report that Rodriguez-Singh lied about her son's whereabouts, claiming he was living with his father in Mexico.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
